intro: Epilobium semiamplexicaule, commonly known as the broad-leaved willow herb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that often have a broad base. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in raceme clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and streambanks. Epilobium semiamplexicaule is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
